page.title: 03HOUSING, EAST BARKWITH
page.content: Until recently, almost all the houses in{South Willingham}were owned by the Hainton estate. Older houses in the village, i.e.,pre-nineteenth century, were built of local stone, or bricks made in the Willingham brick works. Two are still thatched, others have locally made pantiles. Nineteenth century houses were made of local brick, but some have slate roofs. Recent bungalows are made of non-local materials. {East Barkwith}has no thatched cottages left. A few houses contain old, small bricks. Several houses and the school are made of{Willingham} brick, and some have pantile roofs. Later houses have slate roofs. Modern houses, and restored houses, use non-local materials.
